title: Ticket #1336: when_to_transfer_output=NEVER
description:
A user is using file transfer, and his job creates a number of files during its run. He doesn't want the files back; output and error are plenty. Condor cannot directly help him.

The current workarounds are:

  • Create an empty file and ask for it back via transfer_output_files. /dev/null works well for this.
  • Do work in a different directory
  • Have the program itself erase the files.

All seem like needless busywork.

The obvious solution is to say 

transfer_output_files=
but that is identical to not specifying transfer_output_files at all: all discovered files are retrieved.

Proposed: 

when_to_transfer_output=NEVER

(This is distinct from "NONE" and "NEVER" which both mean "User failed to specify: issue an error. If you bodge one of them into your ClassAd, anything that is not ON_EXIT_OR_EVICT is treated as ON_EXIT.)

This disables all output transfer other than stdout and stderr, whose transfer can already be disabled via other attributes. See ticket #5159.
